body: REM COMMENT "This is a comment for ZEIT album"
SONGWRITER "Richard Z. Kruspe, Paul Landers, Till Lindemann, Christian Lorenz, Oliver Riedel and Christoph Schneider"
REM COMMENT "This is a comment for Armee der Tristen track"
SONGWRITER "Richard Z. Kruspe, Paul Landers, Till Lindemann, Christian Lorenz, Oliver Riedel and Christoph Schneider"
REM COMMENT "This is a comment for Zeit track"
CUE Template.description: Add A New CUE Sheet Template

CATALOG.description:
CATALOG (command)
 You can use
 the CATALOG command to
 specify your disc’s
 Media Catalog Number (MCN).
 The MCN is encoded
 according to UPC/EAN
 rules. You typically use
 this command only when
 mastering a CD-ROM for
 commercial production.

 Syntax:
 CATALOG MCN
 MCN - Media Catalog Number,
 must be 13 characters.

REM.description:
REM (command)
 You can use
 the REM command to add
 comments in your
 CUE SHEET file. CDRWIN does
 not compile lines in your
 cuesheet that start with
 the REM command. Successive
 lines of comments must
 begin with the REM command.

 Syntax:
 REM string
 string - Your comments.
 There is no restriction
 on how long your comments
 can be, but successive
 lines of comments must
 begin with the REM command.

UPC.description:
UPC (command)
 The UPC is a Barcode and
 not necessarily the same
 as a CATALOG, and can be
 12-13 digits in length.

 Syntax:
 UPC code
 code - 12-13 digits.

DISCID.description:
DISCID (command)
 The DISCID is
 an 8-symbols hexadecimal
 (base-16) number, computed
 using data from a CD's
 Table-of-Contents (TOC) in
 MSF (Minute Second Frame)
 form.

 Syntax:
 DISCID code
 code - 8 characters.

GENRE.description:
GENRE (command)
 A track or a CD-Disc genre.
 For example: Rock, Jazz

 Syntax:
 GENRE "string"
 string - a track or
 a CD-Disc genre.
 It must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

DATE.description:
DATE (command)
 The date of release.

 Syntax:
 DATE "YYYY"
 or
 DATE "YYYY-MM-DD"
 YYYY - the year
 MM - the month
 DD - the day
 of release.
 It must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

DISCNUMBER.description:
DISCNUMBER (command)
 You can use
 the DISCNUMBER command to
 specify your disc number
 in the release.

 For example:
 DISCNUMBER 1

 Syntax:
 DISCNUMBER num
 num - from 1 to total discs
 in the release.

TOTALDISCS.description:
TOTALDISCS (command)
 You can use
 the TOTALDISCS command to
 specify total discs
 in the release.

 An example for 2 discs:
 TOTALDISCS 2

 Syntax:
 TOTALDISCS num
 num - total discs
 in the release.

COMMENT.description:
COMMENT (command)
 You can use
 the COMMENT command
 to specify the comments for
 a CD-Disk or a track.

 For example:
 ExactAudioCopy v0.01

 Syntax:
 COMMENT "string"
 string - Any comments.
 If the string contains any
 spaces, it must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

CDTEXTFILE.description:
CDTEXTFILE (command)
 Use the CDTEXTFILE command
 to specify the name of the
 file that contains the
 encoded CD-Text information
 for the disc. This command
 is only used with files that
 were either created with
 CDRWIN’s graphical CD-Text
 editor, or generated
 automatically by the
 software when copying
 a CD-Text enhanced disc.

 Syntax:
 CDTEXTFILE "FileName"
 FileName - The CD-Text
 file’s filename (can
 include device/directory).
 If the filename contains
 any spaces, then it must be
 enclosed in quotation marks.

TRACK.description:
TRACK (command)
 A number between 01 and 99
 indicating the track number.

 Syntax:
 TRACK num Type
 num - Track number (1 to 99)
 Type - Track datatype:
 		AUDIO
 		MODE1/2048
 		MODE1/2352
 		MODE2/2336
 		MODE2/2352
 		CDI/2336
 		CDI/2352
 		CDG

PERFORMER.description:
PERFORMER (command)
 You can use
 the PERFORMER command
 to specify the name of
 a performer for a
 CD-Text enhanced disc.

 Syntax:
 PERFORMER "string"
 string - performer's name.
 Name is 1 to 80 characters.
 If the string contains any
 spaces, it must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

TITLE.description:
TITLE (command)
 You can use
 the TITLE command to
 specify a title for a
 CD-Text enhanced disc.

 Syntax:
 TITLE "string"
 string - the track or
 the disc name.
 Name is 1 to 80 characters.
 If the string contains any
 spaces, it must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

SONGWRITER.description:
SONGWRITER (command)
 You can use
 the SONGWRITER command
 to specify the name of
 a songwriter for a
 CD-Text enhanced disc.

 Syntax:
 SONGWRITER "string"
 string - songwriter's name.
 Name is 1 to 80 characters.
 If the string contains any
 spaces, it must be enclosed
 in quotation marks.

ISRC.description:
ISRC (command)
 You can use the IRSC command
 to specify a track's
 International Standard
 Recording Code (ISRC).
 You typically use this
 command only when mastering
 a CD-ROM for commercial
 production.

 Syntax:
 ISRC code
 code - 12 characters.
 The first five characters
 are alphanumeric, the last
 seven are numeric only.

PREGAP.description:
PREGAP (command)
 A space dividing tracks,
 recorded before the track
 data area. The length of
 the pre-gap varies with the
 CD recorder and the types of
 tracks. Where successive
 tracks are both of data, one
 track is separated from
 another by a track pre-gap
 of 150 sectors (2 seconds).
 Where successive tracks are
 of different types (audio
 or data), the pre-gap is
 usually of 225 sectors (or
 three seconds).

 Syntax:
 POSTGAP mm:ss:ff
 mm - minutes
 ss - seconds
 ff - frames
 There are 75 frames per sec.

INDEX.description:
INDEX (command)
 You can use
 the INDEX command to specify
 indexes (or subindexes)
 within a track.

 Syntax:
 INDEX num mm:ss:ff
 num - index number (00 to 99)
 mm - minutes (00 to ∞)
 ss - seconds (00 to 59)
 ff - frames (00 to 75)

POSTGAP.description:
POSTGAP (command)
 A space dividing tracks,
 recorded at the end of the
 track’s data area. The
 post-gap is 150 sectors
 (2 seconds) long and is
 required only where
 successive tracks are of
 different types.

 Syntax:
 POSTGAP mm:ss:ff
 mm - minutes
 ss - seconds
 ff - frames
 There are 75 frames per sec.

FILE \"Audiofile.flac\" File Type.description:
FILE (command)
 Use the FILE command to
 specify the data or audio
 file to be written to your
 recorder.

 Syntax:
 FILE "FileName" FileType
 FileName - The audio or data
 	file’s filename (can
 	include device and
 	directory). If the
 	filename contains any
 	spaces, the filename
 	must be enclosed
 	in quotation marks.
 FileType - The audio or
 	data file’s filetype:
 		WAVE
 		AIFF
 		MP3
 		MOTOROLA
 		BINARY

BINARY.description:
BINARY (File Type)
 Intel binary file.
 File extension for Intel
 (least significant byte first)
 binary format. This is the
 default file format when you
 create an image file from
 the Extract Disc 
Image/Cuesheet Window.

MOTOROLA.description:
MOTOROLA (File Type)
 Motorola binary file.
 File extension for Motorola
 (most significant byte last)
 binary format.

AIFF.description:
AIFF (File Type)
 File extension for
 Audio Interchange File Format
 (AIFF).
 AIFF is the standard audio format
 for Macintosh computers.

WAVE.description:
WAVE (File Type)
 File extension for waveform
 audio format. Waveform is
 the standard audio format
 for PCs and is the default
 file format when you create
 an image file with the
 Select Tracks option in the
 Extract Tracks Window.

MP3.description:
MP3 (File Type)
 Moving Pictures Expert Group,
 Audio Layer 3.
 A type of audio compression
 that provides high quality
 sound in reduced file sizes
 when compared to
 uncompressed audio formats,
 such as waveform.
 CDRWIN does not create image
 files in MP3 format, but
 you can record MP3 files to
 a disc from the Record Disc
 dialog box.

_SECTION_4_TRACK_TYPE: TRACK Type. The following datatypes are allowed:

MODE2/2336.description:
MODE2/2336 (Track Type)
 CD-ROM XA Mode2 Data.

MODE2/2352.description:
MODE2/2352 (Track Type)
 CD-ROM XA Mode2 Data.

_SECTION_5_FLAGS: FLAGS - You can use the FLAGS command to set special subcode flags within a track. You can specify one or more flags for a track

FLAGS.description:
FLAGS (command)
 You can use
 the FLAGS command to set
 special subcode flags within
 a track. You can specify one
 or more flags for a track.

 Syntax:
 FLAGS Type
 Type - Specifies one or more
 track flags. The following
 flags are allowed:
 		DCP
 		4CH
 		PRE
 		SCMS

SCMS.description:
SCMS (Flag)
 Serial Copy
 Management System

 (not supported by
 all recorders).
